page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: The area has two County Primary Schools, one at Crowntown and another at Godolphin. Sithney C.P.School at Crowntown provides education for just over sixty children, aged between 4 and 11 years. The School has a Headteacher and two full_time teachers employed by the County Council. The School building dates from 1912 although it has recently been modernised. Herland Cross C.P. School at Godolphin also provides education for just over sixty children aged between 4 and 11 years and has a similar number of staff to Sithney. However, the building dates from 1876 although modernisations have been carried out. Cont'd...
